basics.name: Brooke Clifton
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Hi! I am a current Junior studying for a B.S. in Computer Science at the University of Hawai'i at Manoa.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI
courses: PHYS 152L: Intro. to Physics II Lab
HAW 100: Language in Hawai'i: Global Issues

work.summary: Tutoring for two students in Math, Science, and English.
highlights: Teach middleschool level Math, Science, and English.
Help expand on concepts introduced in class with context about future lessons to come.
Babysat ages ranging from one to six.
Helped resolve conflict, encourage good developmental practices.

volunteer.summary: Array of community service projects, increasing in complexity over 13 years.
highlights: Gold Award, Silver Award, and Bronze Award (See 'awards').
Aid for the Homeless: Hosted an event to collect and distribute food and hygeine items for homeless people in our community.
Dog Shelter Care Packages: Made recycled dog toys and beds for dogs in the local shelter.
Old Age Home Community Service: Provided company, support, and entertainment to the elderly.

awards.title: Gold Award
awards.summary: For my Girl Scout Gold Award, I led an initiative to make AEDs accessible at schools hosting the local kidsâ€™ soccer league and taught students how to use them. I petitioned administrators to place unlocked AEDs near fields, created educational materials, and managed all aspects of the project, building skills in leadership, communication, and community impact.

awards.title: Silver Award
awards.summary: For my Girl Scout Silver Award, I installed a Little Free Library at a neighborhood bus stop near the elementary school to promote reading, sharing, and community connection. I organized the project from planning through fundraising, installation, and encouraging families and students to exchange books.
